content.description: A short route that packs in 2 distinct cruxes. Big moves on positive holds lead to a balancy few moves into the crack at the base of the roof. From here a tricky sequence utilizing a key fingerlock will take you to the top of the cliff and the anchor. Falling at the top crux results in a nice clean fall into space. So far, there has only been once ascent though a couple of able bodied people have had a couple cracks at it.
content.protection: 4 bolts and biners on the anchor. There is a fixed wired nut in the crack at the roof for the shorter folk who may be discouraged by the reach out the small roof for the last bolt.

content.description: The west facing wall visible from the top switchback on the approach trail if looking east. Rock quality is mixed, but the established route sports great rock similar to The Oven or Way Gone walls. The wall gets morning shade.
